amendment.description: Amendment sought to increase funding for the National Center for Injury Prevention and Control by $2.6 million and decrease Area Health Education Centers funding accordingly.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 4 in the Congressional Record of July 9, 1996, to increase funds appropriated in the bill for the Center for Deasease Control research activities by $2.6 million and reduce funds appropriated for Health Resources and Services Administration comensurately. The intent of the amendment is to fund research into firearm-related injuries.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Lowey amendment (A007) Failed by recorded vote: 158 - 263 (Roll no. 302).
